text: you just can't alter it _after_ `reshape`ing it
But reshaping it doesn't actually create a Matrix?

elements.text: But reshaping it doesn't actually create a Matrix?

text:
By the time you’ve expanded it and reshaped it, what’s left of the old object?
```julia> v = Int[]; pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000113667b60, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> sizehint!(v, 4); pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> push!(v, 1,2,3,4); pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> reshape(v,2,2)
2×2 Matrix{Int64}:
 1  3
 2  4

julia> pointer(ans), objectid(ans)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x5949bf0a568f908b)```

elements.text: By the time you’ve expanded it and reshaped it, what’s left of the old object?

julia> v = Int[]; pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000113667b60, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> sizehint!(v, 4); pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> push!(v, 1,2,3,4); pointer(v), objectid(v)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x86fdf963356032a4)

julia> reshape(v,2,2)
2×2 Matrix{Int64}:
 1  3
 2  4

julia> pointer(ans), objectid(ans)
(Ptr{Int64} @0x0000000114a862c0, 0x5949bf0a568f908b)

text: while it does return a matrix, the underlying data is also pointed to by the vector and you can't alter the existing vector after the fact

elements.text: while it does return a matrix, the underlying data is also pointed to by the vector and you can't alter the existing vector after the fact

text: That's no problem, the vector is only used to build the matrix incrementally, and never exposed to the user
